definition: to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to know/to be aware
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: This is what I meant by, see possibility and advance, knowing difficulty and withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 这就是所谓，见可而进，知难而退。

sentences.english: I think it is quit small ants.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这只小蚂蚁是知难而退。

sentences.english: You should tell him you're busy, or just politely brush him off.
sentences.chinese: 老实告诉他你很忙，或许可以让他知难而退。

definition: to submit/to give in
lit. to beat the return drum (idiom)/fig. to give up/to turn tail
to give up/to admit failure/to drop the matter/to reconcile oneself to loss/to have no more illusions about
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
delaying tactics/deliberate procrastination
to use force
lit. to retreat three day's march (idiom); fig. to give way in the face of superior strength/a strategic withdrawal
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to concede/to admit defeat
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
